snippet: The solar panel installation company had expected to raise up to $151 million with shares priced at $13 to $15, but on Wednesday the company lowered its sights.
abstract: The solar panel installation company had expected to raise up to $151 million with shares priced at $13 to $15, but on Wednesday the company lowered its sights.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED and DIANE CARDWELL

headline.print_headline: A Solar Company Slashes The Price of Its Initial Shares
